extractions.description: This paper presents DJINN, a diffusion based method of generating traffic scenarios for autonomous vehicles. DJINN diffuses trajectories of all agents conditioned on a flexible set of state observations and reports state-of-the-art performance on joint trajectory metrics. The flexibility of DJINN allows it to perform test-time sampling from various conditional distributions, including goal-based sampling, behavior-class sampling, and scenario editing.

title.value: A Diffusion-Model of Joint Interactive Navigation
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as mentioned in the provided text.
title.quote: A Diffusion-Model of Joint Interactive Navigation

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and reporting of performance metrics on popular trajectory forecasting datasets.
type.quote: On popular trajectory forecasting datasets, we report state of the art performance on joint trajectory metrics.

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on a diffusion-based deep learning model for generating traffic scenarios, which falls under the domain of deep learning.
research_field.quote: Our approach jointly diffuses the trajectories of all agents, conditioned on a flexible set of state observations from the past, present, or future.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper proposes a generative model (DJINN) that can produce joint traffic scenarios and perform various conditional sampling tasks.
sub_research_field.quote: DJINN is a diffusion model over the joint states of all agents in the scene.

name.justification: DJINN is the main model proposed and contributed by the paper.
name.quote: we propose DJINN, a model which generatively produces joint traffic scenarios with flexible conditioning.

type.justification: The paper clearly states that DJINN is a diffusion model for generating traffic scenarios.
type.quote: DJINN is a diffusion model over the joint states of all agents in the scene.

name.justification: Scene Transformer is used for comparison with DJINN in joint motion forecasting tasks.
name.quote: We further analyze the joint motion forecasting performance of DJINN. We compare DJINN against a reproduction of Scene Transformer trained for joint motion forecasting, using their reported hyperparameters.

type.justification: Scene Transformer uses a transformer network for jointly producing trajectory sets for all agents.
type.quote: Scene Transformer [30], which uses a similar backbone architecture to our method, uses a transformer [48] network to jointly produce trajectory sets for all agents in the scene.

name.justification: The Argoverse dataset is used to evaluate DJINN's performance on joint and ego-only motion forecasting.
name.quote: We evaluate the quality of sampled trajectories with both joint and ego-only motion forecasting on the Argoverse [4] and INTERACTION [53] datasets.

name.justification: The INTERACTION dataset is used to evaluate DJINN's performance on joint and ego-only motion forecasting.
name.quote: We evaluate the quality of sampled trajectories with both joint and ego-only motion forecasting on the Argoverse [4] and INTERACTION [53] datasets.

name.justification: PyTorch is used as the primary deep learning framework for implementing DJINN's architecture and training the models.
name.quote: We train our network on a modification of the objective from EDM [21]... We utilize the Adam optimizer with learning rate of 3E-4.
